Arsenic.title: Arsenic Impairment
Arsenic.description: Linear feet of streams listed for arsenic per 12 digit HUC.
Arsenic.importance: Arsenic levels are quantified per 12 digit HUCs based on linear feet of arsenic impairment.
Arsenic.tech_notes: Though linear feet of impairment may not be the most robust indicator for arsenic, the geographic data made available in the U.S. EPA 303(d) list are leveraged to highlight the the use of this technology. 12 digit HUCs are used as the target layer for cross-metric comparisson. Additional datasets can be processed to the HUC 12 dataset to satisfy demands for analysis, data display, and security.
Arsenic.links:
303(d) Listed Impaired Waters
Watershed Boundary Dataset
Total Maximum Daily Loads (303d)

CC1PCT.title: % Coverage Fire Condition Class 1
CC1PCT.description: Percentage coverage of HUC defined as Fire Condition Class 1
CC1PCT.importance: Fire condition class is an important metric when accounting for forest and watershed health. Stand replacing forest fires can can have a transformative effect on habitat, water quality and natural resources.
CC1PCT.tech_notes: The data for used for this indicator was generated soley for proof of concept purposes and does not represent ground conditions.
CC1PCT.source: Source: No Source Data - Proof of concept purposes only.
CC1PCT.links:
Fire Regime Condition Class Definition
Fire Regime Condition Class Examples
